result.execSummary:
The defendant Rolando D Drayton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: All conditions of Probation shall remain the same for Extended Supervision.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.
If probation or extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment and or school.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant shall not associate with known drug dealers or users or be present in any place where controlled substances are illegally purchased, sold or consumed.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens including blood, breath or urine.  
Defendant shall obtain/maintain a stable residence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rolando D Drayton

records.addlTxt: Probation discharged.
Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned).

Def in person & by Atty Alyssa Armbrust.  Intern Michelle Alexander and Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State.  Resolution reached; defense free to argue.  Guilty plea entered.  Court finds def guilty.  Argument by counsel.  Statement by Defendant.  Court proceeds to sentencing.  Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights.
Arraignment on July 6, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Arraignment on June 15, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Alyssa Armbrust.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper for State.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.  Arraignment scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 09:45 am.
